sub_subcategories.name: Aluminium
sub_subcategories.description: Raw aluminium material for production. This includes various forms like sheets (thin, flat pieces), plates (thicker than sheets), bars (solid, long pieces), tubes (hollow), profiles, and extrusions. These are basic forms of aluminium before any specific machining.

sub_subcategories.name: Stainless Steel
sub_subcategories.description: Raw stainless steel material, known for its corrosion resistance. It comes in forms like sheets, plates, bars, tubes, and profiles for various manufacturing needs.

sub_subcategories.name: Carbon & Alloy Steel
sub_subcategories.description: Includes raw carbon and alloy steel materials. These are fundamental for structures and components requiring high strength. Available in sheets, plates, bars, and tubes.

sub_subcategories.name: Titanium
sub_subcategories.description: High-strength and lightweight titanium for advanced applications. Provided in raw forms like sheets, bars, and tubes.

sub_subcategories.name: Copper & Alloys
sub_subcategories.description: Raw copper and its alloys, including brass and bronze. Valued for their conductivity and corrosion resistance. Used for electrical components, fittings, and aesthetic parts.

sub_subcategories.name: Nickel Alloys
sub_subcategories.description: Raw nickel-based alloys, known for their high-temperature and corrosion resistance. Used in demanding environments like engines and chemical processing equipment.

sub_subcategories.name: Magnesium Alloys
sub_subcategories.description: Very lightweight magnesium alloys. Used where weight is a critical factor, such as in aerospace and automotive applications.

sub_subcategories.name: Coated & Galvanized
sub_subcategories.description: Metals with protective coatings, such as galvanization (zinc coating), to prevent corrosion. Suitable for outdoor or harsh environment applications.

sub_subcategories.name: Tool & Spring Steel
sub_subcategories.description: Specialized steels with high hardness and resilience. Tool steels are for cutting and forming tools, while spring steels are for manufacturing springs and similar components.

sub_subcategories.name: Rods & Bars
sub_subcategories.description: Solid metal products in long, straight forms. Rods are typically round, while bars can be round, square, rectangular, or other shapes. A basic stock material for machining.

sub_subcategories.name: Sheets & Strips
sub_subcategories.description: Flat metal products. Sheets are wider, while strips are narrower. Used for forming, stamping, and cutting into various parts.

sub_subcategories.name: Brass Tubes
sub_subcategories.description: Hollow tubes made of brass (a copper-zinc alloy). Used for plumbing, decorative applications, and musical instruments due to its workability and acoustic properties.

sub_subcategories.name: Wires & Cables
sub_subcategories.description: Flexible metal strands. Wires are single strands, while cables are bundles of wires. Primarily used for conducting electricity or transmitting signals.

sub_subcategories.name: Fiberglass Fabrics
sub_subcategories.description: Woven materials made from glass fibers. Used as a reinforcement in composite parts, offering good strength and stiffness. Available in different weave patterns like Plain and Twill.

sub_subcategories.name: Aramid Fabrics
sub_subcategories.description: High-strength, heat-resistant synthetic fabrics (e.g., Kevlar, Nomex). Used for ballistic protection, and in aerospace and industrial applications where high strength-to-weight ratio is needed.

sub_subcategories.name: Carbon Fiber Fabrics
sub_subcategories.description: Fabrics woven from carbon fibers, offering exceptional stiffness, strength, and low weight. Used in high-performance applications like aerospace, racing, and sporting goods. Available in various weaves like Plain, Twill, and UD (uni-directional).

sub_subcategories.name: PMI Cores
sub_subcategories.description: Polymethacrylimide (PMI) foam cores. A rigid, closed-cell foam used as a structural core in sandwich composite construction, offering high strength and temperature resistance.

sub_subcategories.name: Honeycomb Cores
sub_subcategories.description: Lightweight structural cores with a honeycomb-like internal structure. Made from materials like Nomex (a flame-resistant meta-aramid) or aluminium. Used to create strong, stiff, and lightweight sandwich panels.

sub_subcategories.name: Composite Auxiliaries
sub_subcategories.description: Consumable materials used in the process of creating composite parts. Includes items like peel ply (for a textured surface), release film (to prevent sticking), breather cloth (to absorb excess resin), bagging film (for vacuum bagging), and infusion media (to aid resin flow).

sub_subcategories.name: Carbon Fiber Profiles
sub_subcategories.description: Pre-made structural shapes made from carbon fiber. Includes tubes, rods, sheets, and plates. These profiles offer high strength and stiffness in a ready-to-use form.

sub_subcategories.name: GFRP Profiles
sub_subcategories.description: Glass Fiber Reinforced Plastic (GFRP) profiles. These are structural shapes like tubes, rods, sheets, and plates made from a combination of glass fibers and a polymer matrix. A cost-effective alternative to carbon fiber.

sub_subcategories.name: Carbon Fiber Sheets
sub_subcategories.description: Flat sheets and plates made from carbon fiber. Sheets are thinner, while plates are thicker, providing a high-strength, lightweight material for structural panels and components.

sub_subcategories.name: Foam
sub_subcategories.description: Various types of foam used as core materials in sandwich panels or for buoyancy and insulation. Can include a wide range of polymer foams.

sub_subcategories.name: Mats & Fabrics
sub_subcategories.description: A broad category for various non-woven mats and woven fabrics used in composite manufacturing. This can include materials like chopped strand mat or other specialized textiles.

sub_subcategories.name: Tapes & Fabrics
sub_subcategories.description: Includes narrow woven tapes and wider fabrics used for reinforcement in specific areas of a composite part, such as along edges or seams.

sub_subcategories.name: Core Materials
sub_subcategories.description: A general category for materials used as the core in a sandwich panel construction. This can include a variety of foams, honeycombs, or other lightweight materials.

sub_subcategories.name: Carbon Fiber Prepreg
sub_subcategories.description: Carbon fiber fabric that has been pre-impregnated with a resin system. This ready-to-use material is cured with heat and pressure, offering a high-quality and consistent composite part.

sub_subcategories.name: Fillers & Additives
sub_subcategories.description: Materials added to resins to modify their properties. Fillers can reduce weight or cost, while additives can improve characteristics like fire resistance, UV stability, or viscosity.

sub_subcategories.name: Carbon Fiber Sandwich Panels
sub_subcategories.description: Ready-made panels consisting of carbon fiber skins bonded to a lightweight core material (like foam or honeycomb). These panels offer excellent stiffness and strength with minimal weight.

sub_subcategories.name: Carbon Fiber Tubes & Rods
sub_subcategories.description: Hollow carbon fiber tubes and solid carbon fiber rods. These are common structural components in applications requiring high stiffness and low weight, such as in drone frames and robotics.

sub_subcategories.name: Sheets & Panels
sub_subcategories.description: A general category for flat stock material. Sheets are typically thinner, while panels can be thicker or refer to a finished or semi-finished flat component.

sub_subcategories.name: Insulation
sub_subcategories.description: Materials used to reduce the transfer of heat or electricity. Can include various foams, fiberglass, or ceramic-based materials.

sub_subcategories.name: Tubes & Pipes
sub_subcategories.description: Hollow cylindrical materials. Tubes are often used for structural purposes, while pipes are typically used for fluid transport. This category can include various materials.

sub_subcategories.name: Fabrics
sub_subcategories.description: A general category for woven or non-woven textiles used in manufacturing. This can include a wide range of materials and applications beyond composites.

sub_subcategories.name: Aramid Cords & Ropes
sub_subcategories.description: Cords and ropes made from high-strength aramid fibers. Used in applications requiring high tensile strength and low stretch, such as in parachute lines or for reinforcing structures.

sub_subcategories.name: Tubing & Hoses
sub_subcategories.description: Flexible or rigid hollow conduits. Tubing is often used for structural applications or for fluid transfer at low pressures. Hoses are typically more flexible and used for fluid transfer at higher pressures.

sub_subcategories.name: Engineering Plastics
sub_subcategories.description: A class of plastic materials with improved mechanical and thermal properties. Includes materials like POM (Acetal), PEEK, UHMW-PE, HDPE, ABS, PC (Polycarbonate), PMMA (Acrylic), and PTFE (Teflon). Used for durable parts, housings, and components.

sub_subcategories.name: Acrylic Sheets
sub_subcategories.description: Transparent thermoplastic sheets (also known as Plexiglas or Perspex). Used for windows, canopies, and displays due to its optical clarity and impact resistance.

sub_subcategories.name: PVC Sheets
sub_subcategories.description: Sheets made from Polyvinyl Chloride (PVC), a versatile and cost-effective plastic. Used for a wide range of applications, including signage, construction materials, and packaging.

sub_subcategories.name: Rubber & Elastomers
sub_subcategories.description: Flexible, elastic materials (elastomers). Includes natural and synthetic rubbers. Used for seals, gaskets, O-rings, and vibration damping. Available in sheets, profiles, and custom shapes. Silicone is a common high-temperature elastomer.

sub_subcategories.name: Structural Adhesives
sub_subcategories.description: High-strength adhesives used to bond structural components. Includes types like Epoxy, Polyurethane (PU), Acrylic, and Cyanoacrylate (CA or super glue). These adhesives can often replace mechanical fasteners.

sub_subcategories.name: Threadlockers & Retaining Compounds
sub_subcategories.description: Anaerobic adhesives used to lock and seal threaded fasteners (threadlockers) or to secure cylindrical parts like bearings and bushings (retaining compounds). They prevent loosening due to vibration and corrosion.

sub_subcategories.name: Potting Compounds
sub_subcategories.description: Resin-based compounds used to encapsulate and protect electronic components from moisture, shock, and vibration. They are poured into a housing containing the electronics and then cured.

sub_subcategories.name: Primers & Surfacers
sub_subcategories.description: Preparatory coatings applied to a surface before painting. Primers ensure good adhesion of the paint, while surfacers (or fillers) are used to create a smooth, uniform surface.

sub_subcategories.name: Release Agents
sub_subcategories.description: Chemicals used to prevent other materials from bonding to surfaces. Commonly used in molding and casting to allow for easy removal of the finished part from the mold.

sub_subcategories.name: Coatings & Paints
sub_subcategories.description: Liquids, liquefiable, or mastic compositions that, after application to a substrate in a thin layer, convert to a solid film. Used for protective, decorative, or functional purposes.

sub_subcategories.name: Solvents & Cleaners
sub_subcategories.description: Liquids used to dissolve, dilute, or clean other substances. Solvents are used to dissolve resins and other materials, while cleaners are used to remove contaminants from surfaces.

sub_subcategories.name: Resins
sub_subcategories.description: Viscous substances that convert into rigid polymers by curing. Used as the matrix material in composites, as adhesives, or for casting and coating. Common types include epoxy, polyester, and vinyl ester resins.

sub_subcategories.name: Conformal Coatings
sub_subcategories.description: Thin polymeric films applied to printed circuit boards (PCBs) to protect the electronic components from moisture, dust, chemicals, and temperature extremes. Can be specialized for electronics or for general use.

sub_subcategories.name: Thermal Interface Materials
sub_subcategories.description: Materials used to enhance thermal conductivity between two surfaces, typically a heat-generating component (like a CPU) and a heat sink. Includes thermal pastes, pads, and greases.

sub_subcategories.name: Fillers & Putties
sub_subcategories.description: Paste-like materials used to fill gaps, cracks, and imperfections in surfaces before painting or finishing. Putties are typically finer and used for smaller defects.

sub_subcategories.name: Oils
sub_subcategories.description: Lubricating oils used to reduce friction between moving parts. Can be mineral-based or synthetic, with various viscosities and additives for different applications.

sub_subcategories.name: Hardeners
sub_subcategories.description: Chemicals that are mixed with a resin to initiate the curing process, causing the resin to harden. Also known as curing agents or catalysts.

sub_subcategories.name: Pigments & Dyes
sub_subcategories.description: Substances used to impart color to other materials. Pigments are insoluble particles that are dispersed in a medium, while dyes are soluble and are absorbed by the material.

sub_subcategories.name: Thinners & Reducers
sub_subcategories.description: Volatile solvents used to decrease the viscosity of paints, coatings, and adhesives, making them easier to apply. Reducers are typically used with specific paint systems.

sub_subcategories.name: Additives
sub_subcategories.description: A broad category for chemicals added to a material to improve its properties. This can include UV stabilizers, fire retardants, flow enhancers, and many other types of modifiers.

sub_subcategories.name: 3D Printing Filaments
sub_subcategories.description: Thermoplastic feedstock for fused deposition modeling (FDM) 3D printers. The filament is unwound from a spool and fed through the printer's extruder. Common materials include PLA, ABS, and PETG.

sub_subcategories.name: 3D Printing Resins
sub_subcategories.description: Photopolymer resins used in 3D printing technologies like stereolithography (SLA) and digital light processing (DLP). The resin is cured by a light source to create a solid object.

sub_subcategories.name: 3D Printing Powders
sub_subcategories.description: Powdered materials used in 3D printing technologies like selective laser sintering (SLS) and multi-jet fusion (MJF). The powder is fused together layer by layer to create a solid object.

sub_subcategories.name: Rubber Sheets
sub_subcategories.description: Flat sheets of rubber material. Used for cutting gaskets, seals, and for providing a non-slip or protective surface. Available in various thicknesses and rubber compounds.

sub_subcategories.name: Fasteners
sub_subcategories.description: A component used to mechanically join or affix two or more objects together. This includes a wide variety of items like bolts, screws, nuts, washers, and specialized aerospace rivets. It also covers custom-made plates and plastic fasteners, as well as threaded inserts for creating strong connections in softer materials.

sub_subcategories.name: Retaining Rings
sub_subcategories.description: A fastener that holds components or assemblies onto a shaft or in a housing/bore when installed in a groove. Includes standard retaining rings and circlips.

sub_subcategories.name: Bearings
sub_subcategories.description: Mechanical components that enable motion between parts, typically by reducing friction. This category includes ball bearings and roller bearings, which are common in a wide range of machinery.

sub_subcategories.name: Bushings
sub_subcategories.description: A type of bearing, typically a sleeve or tube that is inserted into a housing to provide a bearing surface for rotary applications. This is a general category for various types of bushings.

sub_subcategories.name: Springs
sub_subcategories.description: Elastic objects that store mechanical energy. This category includes compression springs (which get shorter when loaded) and torsion springs (which work by twisting). Used in a wide variety of mechanical assemblies.

sub_subcategories.name: Gears
sub_subcategories.description: Rotating machine parts with cut teeth, which mesh with another toothed part to transmit torque. This category includes spur gears (with straight teeth) and helical gears (with angled teeth).

sub_subcategories.name: Pulleys & Belts
sub_subcategories.description: Used to transmit power between shafts. Belts are looped over pulleys. This category includes timing belts for synchronized motion and general-purpose belts.

sub_subcategories.name: Shafts
sub_subcategories.description: A rotating machine element, usually circular in cross section, which is used to transmit power from one part to another, or from a machine which produces power to a machine which absorbs power.

sub_subcategories.name: Couplings
sub_subcategories.description: A device used to connect two shafts together at their ends for the purpose of transmitting power. Couplings do not normally allow disconnection of shafts during operation.

sub_subcategories.name: Hinges
sub_subcategories.description: A mechanical bearing that connects two solid objects, typically allowing only a limited angle of rotation between them. Used for doors, lids, and other articulating parts.

sub_subcategories.name: Latches & Locks
sub_subcategories.description: Mechanical fasteners that join two or more objects or surfaces while allowing for their regular separation. Latches are used to hold doors and panels closed, while locks provide additional security.

sub_subcategories.name: Mounts
sub_subcategories.description: A general category for components used to secure or support other parts. This can include engine mounts, sensor mounts, or any other type of bracket or fixture.

sub_subcategories.name: Pins
sub_subcategories.description: Cylindrical fasteners used to locate, align, and join components. This can include dowel pins, cotter pins, and other similar fasteners.

sub_subcategories.name: Dampers & Vibration Control
sub_subcategories.description: Components used to absorb or reduce mechanical shocks and vibrations. Dampers dissipate energy, while other vibration control elements isolate components from vibration sources.

sub_subcategories.name: Pneumatic Tubing & Fittings
sub_subcategories.description: Components used to create pneumatic circuits for carrying compressed air. This includes various types of tubing and the corresponding fittings (like push-in connectors) to join them.

sub_subcategories.name: Rod Ends / Ball Joints
sub_subcategories.description: Mechanical joints that provide pivoting and rotational movement. Rod ends are used at the end of control rods, while ball joints are common in steering and suspension systems.

sub_subcategories.name: Hose & Tubing Fittings
sub_subcategories.description: Connectors and clamps used to join hoses and tubing to other components, such as pumps, valves, and other hoses. Ensures a secure, leak-free connection.

sub_subcategories.name: Cable Chains / Drag Chains
sub_subcategories.description: Flexible conduits designed to guide and protect electrical cables and hydraulic or pneumatic hoses on moving machinery. They prevent wear and stress on the cables.

sub_subcategories.name: Clamps
sub_subcategories.description: A fastening device used to hold or secure objects tightly together to prevent movement or separation through the application of inward pressure.

sub_subcategories.name: Hardware
sub_subcategories.description: A broad category for miscellaneous small metal items used in building and manufacturing. This can include items like brackets, hooks, and other fittings that don't fall into more specific categories.

sub_subcategories.name: Mounts & Brackets
sub_subcategories.description: Components used to attach, support, or position other parts. Mounts are often used for specific components like engines or sensors, while brackets are more general-purpose.

sub_subcategories.name: Ballast & Weights
sub_subcategories.description: Heavy material added to a vehicle or structure to provide stability or to adjust its weight and balance. Can be made from various dense materials.

sub_subcategories.name: Vibration Control
sub_subcategories.description: A general category for components designed to mitigate the effects of vibration. This can include dampers, isolators, and other specialized elements.

sub_subcategories.name: Shafts & Rods
sub_subcategories.description: A general category for long, cylindrical components. Shafts typically rotate and transmit power, while rods are often used for structural support or as linkages.

sub_subcategories.name: Structural Parts
sub_subcategories.description: A broad category for components that form the main frame or load-bearing elements of a structure. This can include beams, channels, angles, and other shapes.

sub_subcategories.name: Anchors
sub_subcategories.description: Fasteners used to attach objects to a substrate like concrete or masonry. This category can include a variety of types, such as wedge anchors, sleeve anchors, and screw anchors.

sub_subcategories.name: Magnets
sub_subcategories.description: Materials that produce a magnetic field. Used for a variety of purposes, including holding, sensing, and in electric motors and actuators. Can be permanent magnets or electromagnets.

sub_subcategories.name: Cable Accessories
sub_subcategories.description: A broad category for items used to manage and secure cables. This can include cable ties, clamps, glands, and markers.

sub_subcategories.name: Vibration Dampers
sub_subcategories.description: Devices designed to absorb and dissipate vibrational energy, reducing unwanted oscillations and noise in mechanical systems.

sub_subcategories.name: Spacers & Standoffs
sub_subcategories.description: Components used to create a precise distance between two parts, often to provide clearance or to align components. Spacers are typically unthreaded, while standoffs are threaded.

sub_subcategories.name: Servo Accessories
sub_subcategories.description: Components that complement servo motors, such as servo horns, linkages, and mounting brackets. These are used to connect the servo to the mechanism it controls.

sub_subcategories.name: Linkages & Joints
sub_subcategories.description: Assemblies of rigid bodies connected by joints to form a closed or open chain. Used to transmit force and motion, often converting one type of motion into another.

sub_subcategories.name: Miscellaneous
sub_subcategories.description: A general category for various mechanical components that do not fit into more specific sub-subcategories. This can include a wide range of small parts and assemblies.

sub_subcategories.name: Seals & Gaskets
sub_subcategories.description: Components used to prevent leakage of fluids or gases between two surfaces. Gaskets are typically static, while seals can be static or dynamic, accommodating movement between parts.

sub_subcategories.name: Fittings & Adapters
sub_subcategories.description: Components used to connect hoses, pipes, or tubes in fluid or pneumatic systems. Fittings join sections, while adapters change the connection type or size.

sub_subcategories.name: Control Linkages
sub_subcategories.description: Mechanical assemblies used to transmit motion and force from a control input (e.g., a lever or pedal) to an output device (e.g., a valve or flap).

sub_subcategories.name: Lubrication
sub_subcategories.description: Materials and systems used to reduce friction and wear between moving surfaces. This includes greases, oils, and solid lubricants, as well as lubrication delivery systems.

sub_subcategories.name: Filters
sub_subcategories.description: Devices used to remove impurities from fluids or gases. This can include air filters, oil filters, fuel filters, and hydraulic filters, essential for protecting sensitive components.

sub_subcategories.name: Maintenance Kits
sub_subcategories.description: Pre-packaged sets of parts and tools required for routine servicing or repair of specific equipment. These kits streamline maintenance operations and ensure correct parts are used.

sub_subcategories.name: Control Systems
sub_subcategories.description: Integrated sets of mechanical, electrical, and software components designed to manage, command, direct, or regulate the behavior of other devices or systems.

sub_subcategories.name: Couplings/Fittings
sub_subcategories.description: Components used to connect or join mechanical parts, often in fluid or power transmission systems. Couplings join rotating shafts, while fittings connect pipes or hoses.

sub_subcategories.name: Fittings & Connectors
sub_subcategories.description: Components used to join pneumatic tubing and hoses, or to connect them to other pneumatic devices like valves and cylinders. Ensures airtight connections for compressed air systems.

sub_subcategories.name: Valves
sub_subcategories.description: Devices that control the flow, direction, or pressure of compressed air in pneumatic systems. This can include directional control valves, pressure relief valves, and flow control valves.

sub_subcategories.name: Gauges
sub_subcategories.description: Instruments used to measure and display pressure in pneumatic systems. Essential for monitoring system performance and ensuring safe operation.

sub_subcategories.name: Optical Components
sub_subcategories.description: Elements used to manipulate light in optical systems. This can include lenses, mirrors, prisms, filters, and beam splitters, used in cameras, sensors, and display systems.

sub_subcategories.name: Connectors
sub_subcategories.description: Devices used to join electrical conductors and create an electrical circuit. This broad category includes connectors for power, signal, data (USB, RJ45, D-Sub), and various specialized types like terminal blocks, IDC, and Molex/Dupont connectors.

sub_subcategories.name: PCB Assemblies
sub_subcategories.description: Printed Circuit Board (PCB) assemblies are boards with electronic components soldered onto them, forming functional electronic circuits. This includes control boards (for logic and processing) and power boards (for power regulation and distribution).

sub_subcategories.name: Sensors
sub_subcategories.description: Devices that detect and respond to physical input from the environment and convert it into an electrical signal. This includes IMUs (Inertial Measurement Units), GPS receivers, air data sensors, Hall effect sensors (for magnetic fields), current sensors, and accelerometers.

sub_subcategories.name: Antennas
sub_subcategories.description: Transducers designed to transmit or receive electromagnetic waves. Used for wireless communication, navigation, and remote sensing applications.

sub_subcategories.name: Actuators
sub_subcategories.description: Devices that convert electrical energy into mechanical motion. This includes servo actuators (for precise rotational control) and linear actuators (for linear motion).

sub_subcategories.name: Power Modules
sub_subcategories.description: Integrated electronic circuits designed to manage and regulate electrical power. This includes ESCs (Electronic Speed Controllers) for motors, BECs (Battery Eliminator Circuits) for providing regulated power, PDBs (Power Distribution Boards), switch-mode power supplies, and DC-DC converters.

sub_subcategories.name: Lighting
sub_subcategories.description: Electrical components that produce light for various purposes. This includes navigation lights (for aircraft/drones), strobe lights (for visibility), LED strips (for general illumination), and beacons (for signaling).

sub_subcategories.name: Switches
sub_subcategories.description: Electrical components used to make or break an electrical circuit. This includes various types like toggle switches, rocker switches, pushbutton switches, limit switches (for position sensing), micro switches, slide switches, and DIP switches.

sub_subcategories.name: Circuit Protection
sub_subcategories.description: Devices designed to protect electrical circuits from overcurrent conditions. This includes fuses (single-use devices that melt to break the circuit) and circuit breakers (reusable devices that trip to break the circuit).

sub_subcategories.name: Relays
sub_subcategories.description: Electrically operated switches that use an electromagnet to open or close contacts. Used to control high-power circuits with a low-power signal. This includes general-purpose relays, automotive relays, and relays with sockets for easy replacement.

sub_subcategories.name: RF Modules
sub_subcategories.description: Electronic circuits that transmit and/or receive radio frequency (RF) signals. Used for wireless communication. This includes standard RF modules and those with encryption capabilities for secure data transmission.

sub_subcategories.name: Flight Controllers
sub_subcategories.description: The central processing unit of an unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV), responsible for interpreting pilot commands, managing flight stability, and controlling motors and other components. Often includes an IMU and other sensors.

sub_subcategories.name: Autopilot Modules
sub_subcategories.description: Integrated systems that provide autonomous control of an aircraft or UAV, managing flight path, altitude, and other parameters without continuous human input. Works in conjunction with flight controllers.

sub_subcategories.name: Batteries
sub_subcategories.description: Energy storage devices that provide electrical power to the system. Flight packs are specifically designed for aerial vehicles, offering high energy density and discharge rates.

sub_subcategories.name: Battery Management
sub_subcategories.description: Systems designed to monitor and control the charging, discharging, and overall health of batteries. Includes BMS (Battery Management Systems), chargers, and power supplies for various battery types.

sub_subcategories.name: RF Coax & Adapters
sub_subcategories.description: Coaxial cables and adapters used for transmitting radio frequency signals with minimal loss. Essential for connecting antennas to RF modules and other communication equipment.

sub_subcategories.name: EMI/EMC Components
sub_subcategories.description: Components designed to suppress electromagnetic interference (EMI) and ensure electromagnetic compatibility (EMC). Includes filters, ferrites, and shielding gaskets to prevent unwanted noise and ensure proper operation of electronic systems.

sub_subcategories.name: Propulsion Motors
sub_subcategories.description: Electric motors specifically designed for generating thrust in aerial vehicles. BLDC (Brushless DC) motors are commonly used due to their high efficiency and power-to-weight ratio.

sub_subcategories.name: Thermal Management
sub_subcategories.description: Systems and components used to regulate the temperature of electronic devices and systems. Includes fans for active cooling and heatsinks for passive heat dissipation.

sub_subcategories.name: Flight Termination
sub_subcategories.description: Safety systems designed to safely terminate the flight of an unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV) in emergency situations. FTS (Flight Termination Systems) ensure the vehicle can be brought down in a controlled manner.

sub_subcategories.name: Passive Components
sub_subcategories.description: Electronic components that do not require an external power source to operate. This includes various types of capacitors (ceramic, electrolytic), resistors, and inductors, fundamental for circuit design.

sub_subcategories.name: Potentiometers & Encoders
sub_subcategories.description: Potentiometers are variable resistors used to measure position or control voltage. Encoders are devices that convert angular or linear position into an analog or digital signal, often used for feedback in control systems.

sub_subcategories.name: Connector Accessories
sub_subcategories.description: Ancillary items used with electrical connectors to improve their performance, protection, or ease of use. This can include backshells, dust caps, strain reliefs, and crimping tools.

sub_subcategories.name: Optoelectronics
sub_subcategories.description: Electronic devices that interact with light. This includes LEDs, photodiodes, optocouplers, and laser diodes, used in various applications from illumination to data communication.

sub_subcategories.name: Resistors
sub_subcategories.description: Passive two-terminal electrical components that implement electrical resistance as a circuit element. Used to reduce current flow, adjust signal levels, and divide voltages.

sub_subcategories.name: Capacitors
sub_subcategories.description: Passive two-terminal electrical components that store electrical energy in an electric field. Used for filtering, timing, and energy storage in electronic circuits.

sub_subcategories.name: Transistors
sub_subcategories.description: Semiconductor devices used to amplify or switch electronic signals and electrical power. They are fundamental building blocks of modern electronic devices.

sub_subcategories.name: Diodes
sub_subcategories.description: Semiconductor devices that allow current to flow in one direction only. Used for rectification, voltage regulation, and signal modulation.

sub_subcategories.name: Potentiometers
sub_subcategories.description: Three-terminal resistors with a sliding or rotating contact that forms an adjustable voltage divider. Used for measuring position or controlling electrical signals.

sub_subcategories.name: Computers & Controllers
sub_subcategories.description: Programmable electronic devices that process data and control the operation of other systems. This includes single-board computers, microcontrollers, and industrial controllers.

sub_subcategories.name: Storage Media
sub_subcategories.description: Devices used for storing digital data. This can include SD cards, USB drives, solid-state drives (SSDs), and other forms of non-volatile memory.

sub_subcategories.name: Integrated Circuits (ICs)
sub_subcategories.description: Miniaturized electronic circuits fabricated on a semiconductor material. ICs are the building blocks of most electronic devices, performing functions like processing, memory, and amplification.

sub_subcategories.name: Timing Components
sub_subcategories.description: Electronic components used to generate or control timing signals in circuits. This includes crystals, oscillators, and timers, crucial for synchronized operations.

sub_subcategories.name: Frames
sub_subcategories.description: The primary load-bearing structure of a system, providing support and enclosure for other components. Chassis modules are specialized frames designed to house and protect electronic or mechanical assemblies.

sub_subcategories.name: Panels
sub_subcategories.description: Flat, often rigid, components that form the outer skin or internal partitions of a structure. They can be made from various materials and provide aerodynamic, protective, or aesthetic functions.

sub_subcategories.name: Fairings
sub_subcategories.description: External structures designed to reduce drag and improve the aerodynamic efficiency of a vehicle. They also serve to protect internal components from environmental elements.

sub_subcategories.name: Covers
sub_subcategories.description: Protective enclosures or lids designed to shield internal components from dust, moisture, physical damage, or to provide aesthetic finishing. Can be removable or permanently affixed.

sub_subcategories.name: Payload Bays
sub_subcategories.description: Dedicated compartments or sections within a vehicle designed to carry and protect mission-specific equipment, such as cameras, sensors, or cargo. Optimized for easy access and integration.

sub_subcategories.name: Doors
sub_subcategories.description: Movable barriers used to open or close an entrance to a compartment or section of a vehicle. They can be hinged, sliding, or removable, providing access for maintenance or operation.

sub_subcategories.name: Cooling Systems
sub_subcategories.description: Integrated systems designed to dissipate heat generated by electronic components or mechanical systems, ensuring optimal operating temperatures. Includes fans, heatsinks, and liquid cooling solutions.

sub_subcategories.name: Tilt Mounts
sub_subcategories.description: Mounting mechanisms that allow for angular adjustment of attached components, such as cameras or sensors. This enables precise aiming and orientation for various operational needs.

sub_subcategories.name: Motor Bays
sub_subcategories.description: Enclosed sections within a vehicle's structure specifically designed to house and protect electric motors or engines. They often include mounting points and provisions for cooling and wiring.

sub_subcategories.name: Recovery Systems
sub_subcategories.description: Integrated systems designed to safely recover a vehicle or its payload in the event of a malfunction or emergency. This can include parachutes, airbags, or other controlled descent mechanisms.

sub_subcategories.name: Safety Equipment
sub_subcategories.description: General category for various safety-related components and devices not covered by more specific categories. This can include emergency lighting, warning systems, or protective barriers.

sub_subcategories.name: Release Mechanisms
sub_subcategories.description: Devices designed to securely hold and then quickly release components or systems. Often used in safety-critical applications for deploying recovery systems or jettisoning payloads.

sub_subcategories.name: Consumables
sub_subcategories.description: Items that are used up or expended during the operation or maintenance of safety systems. This can include items like CO2 cartridges for airbags, flares, or single-use medical supplies.

sub_subcategories.name: Flow Sensors
sub_subcategories.description: Devices used to measure the rate of fluid or gas movement. Essential for monitoring fuel consumption, air intake, or hydraulic system performance.

sub_subcategories.name: Avionics Modules
sub_subcategories.description: Self-contained electronic units that perform specific functions within an aircraft's avionics system. Designed for quick removal and replacement to facilitate maintenance and upgrades.

sub_subcategories.name: Payload Modules
sub_subcategories.description: Self-contained units designed to carry specific mission equipment, such as cameras for imaging, sensors for data collection, or delivery mechanisms for cargo. These modules are easily interchangeable for mission flexibility.

sub_subcategories.name: Fuel Pumps
sub_subcategories.description: Mechanical or electrical devices that transfer fuel from the tank to the engine. Essential for maintaining consistent fuel pressure and flow for engine operation.

sub_subcategories.name: Fuel Filters
sub_subcategories.description: Devices that remove contaminants from fuel before it reaches the engine. Essential for protecting fuel system components and ensuring optimal engine performance.

sub_subcategories.name: Fuel Lines & Fittings
sub_subcategories.description: Hoses, tubes, and connectors designed to safely transport fuel throughout the system. Ensures leak-free connections and compatibility with various fuel types.

sub_subcategories.name: Exhaust Components
sub_subcategories.description: Parts of a system designed to guide exhaust gases away from an engine. This can include manifolds, pipes, mufflers, and catalytic converters, managing emissions and noise.

sub_subcategories.name: Valves & Regulators
sub_subcategories.description: Devices used to control the flow and pressure of fuel within the system. Valves direct fuel, while regulators maintain a constant output pressure, crucial for engine performance.

sub_subcategories.name: Motor Mounts
sub_subcategories.description: Structural components designed to securely attach electric motors or engines to the airframe. They absorb vibrations and ensure proper alignment for efficient power transfer.

sub_subcategories.name: Turbines
sub_subcategories.description: Rotary mechanical devices that extract energy from a fluid flow and convert it into useful work. Used in jet engines and other power generation systems.

sub_subcategories.name: Exhaust Systems
sub_subcategories.description: Complete assemblies designed to channel and expel exhaust gases from an engine. Includes all components from the engine manifold to the exhaust outlet, managing noise and emissions.

sub_subcategories.name: Motor + Propeller Components
sub_subcategories.description: Individual components that make up a motor and propeller assembly, such as propeller blades, hubs, motor shafts, and mounting hardware. These are typically sold separately for customization or replacement.

sub_subcategories.name: Engines
sub_subcategories.description: Power-generating units that convert fuel into mechanical energy to provide thrust. This can include internal combustion engines (ICE), electric motors, or jet engines, depending on the propulsion system.

sub_subcategories.name: Propellers
sub_subcategories.description: Rotating blades that convert rotational motion into propulsive force by acting on a fluid (typically air or water). Available in various sizes, pitches, and materials for different applications.

sub_subcategories.name: Fuel System Components
sub_subcategories.description: Individual parts that make up a complete fuel system, including tanks, lines, pumps, filters, and injectors. These components work together to store, deliver, and meter fuel to the engine.

sub_subcategories.name: Pumps
sub_subcategories.description: Mechanical devices that move fluids (liquids or gases) by mechanical action. Used in propulsion systems for fuel delivery, lubrication, or cooling.

sub_subcategories.name: Ignition Systems
sub_subcategories.description: Electrical systems responsible for initiating combustion in internal combustion engines. Includes spark plugs, ignition coils, magnetos, and associated wiring.

sub_subcategories.name: Starters
sub_subcategories.description: Electric motors or other devices used to crank an internal combustion engine to initiate its operation. Essential for starting engines, especially in larger propulsion systems.

sub_subcategories.name: UAV Platforms
sub_subcategories.description: The complete structural assembly of an unmanned aerial vehicle, including the fuselage, wings, and landing gear. These platforms provide the basic framework for integrating all other systems.

sub_subcategories.description: ESD Protection sits within the esd & moisture control segment of the consumables, safety & packaging category and covers options such as Shielding Bag, Moisture Barrier Bag, Desiccant Pack and Humidity Indicator Card (stage: consumable; origin: mixed; usage: production).
